conclusion: Understanding the circuit components and the problem statement.
Circuit includes a battery, resistors (10 ohms, 20 ohms, R), a voltmeter, and a switch S.
Voltmeter is connected across the 20-ohm resistor.
Switch S is in series with the 10-ohm resistor.
When S is open, the 10-ohm resistor is out of the circuit.
The voltmeter reads 6V across the 20-ohm resistor, meaning the voltage across R is also 6V.
When S is closed, the 10-ohm resistor is in parallel with the 20-ohm resistor.
The parallel combination of 10 ohms and 20 ohms is in series with R and the battery.
Points a and b are the terminals across which the voltage is being asked when S is closed.
Equivalent resistance of the parallel combination of 10 ohms and 20 ohms is calculated.
